EXISTING STRUCTURES
──────────────────────
### Stone Furnace Facility at position (0.0, 0.0)
Consists of:
- Stone Furnace (position: 0.0, 0.0) – Smelts iron ore into iron plates.
- Iron Chest (position: 1.5, 0.5) – Stores produced iron plates.

### Iron Ore Mining Setup at position (-16.0, -51.0)
Consists of:
- Burner Mining Drill (position: -16.0, -51.0) – Extracts iron ore; currently displays a “NO_FUEL” status with an “out of fuel” warning.
- Burner Inserter (position: -14.5, -49.5) – Transfers ore from the mining drill with a pickup at (-13.5, -49.5) and a drop at (-15.5, -49.5).
- Transport Belt (position: -15.5, -49.5) – Placed as a sink at the drill’s drop point to reroute ore.
- Intermediate Transport Belt (position: -15.5, -47.5) – Provides a cardinal path segment intended to bridge the belt sink with the inserter target.
- Burner Inserter (position: -14.5, -47.5) – Positioned adjacent to the remote container; configured with a pickup at (-15.5, -47.5) and a drop at (-13.5, -47.5).
- Remote Output Chest (position: -13.5, -47.5) – Serves as the output container, currently holding 60 units of iron ore.
Note: Multiple connection attempts using transport belts and inserters have encountered path alignment and validation errors, leaving the intended belt chain incomplete.

ERROR TIPS
──────────
• Entity Retrieval and API Usage
  - Validate that an entity exists at a given position before attempting to retrieve or manipulate it to avoid exceptions.
  - Supply valid, non-position entity objects when invoking inspection or retrieval APIs.

• Placement Distance and Target Positioning
  - Ensure the player’s position is within the allowed placement range (e.g. within 10 units) before placing an entity to prevent “position too far” errors.
  - Verify that target tiles are buildable and unoccupied before attempting placement.

• Connection Validity and Path Construction
  - When linking entities, use appropriate intermediary components; for example, transport belts cannot be directly connected to chests and require an inserter as the connection target.
  - Confirm that connected entities align along cardinal directions and, if necessary, employ additional intermediate segments to form a valid normalized path.

• Inventory and Crafting Prerequisites
  - Always check that the required items (such as transport belts and burner inserters) are available in inventory prior to placement; missing components lead to placement failures.
  - Before crafting, ensure that all necessary sub-ingredients and processing facilities (e.g. furnaces for smelting iron plates) are in place to satisfy recipe requirements.

• Fuel Management
  - Monitor fuel levels for burner mining drills and refuel them promptly to avoid operational downtimes.
